pages.text: A hearty dish of succulent chicken and veggies in a thick broth. The word Stew comes from the old french word Estuve, which referred to a cauldron or stove.

pages.title: Chicken Stew
pages.text: $(br) Time: 1hr 5min $(br) Servings: 6 $(br2)$(l) Ingredients - $()$(br)$(li) 1 1/2 pounds chicken breasts or thighs $(li) 1 teaspoon salt $(li)1/4 teaspoon black pepper $(li)3 tablespoons butter divided $(li)1 tablespoon olive oil $(li)1 medium onion diced

$(li)3-4 cloves minced garlic about 2 teaspoons $(li)4 carrots cut into bite-sized chunks $(li)4 celery stalks sliced $(li)4 cups chicken broth $(li)1 1/2 pounds red potatoes cut into bite-sized chunks $(li)4 bay leaves $(li)1 teaspoon sage $(li)1 teaspoon thyme $(li)1/2 teaspoon rosemary $(li)2 teaspoons parsley for garnishing $(li)1/4 cup cold water $(li)2 tablespoons cornstarch

$(li)Season chicken with salt and black pepper. In a large pot over medium-high heat, heat 1 tablespoon butter and 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Add chicken breasts and cook 5-7 minutes per side, until browned and cooked through. Transfer cooked chicken to a cutting board and shred.

$(li)Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter to the same pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion, garlic, carrots, and celery. Cook 8-10 minutes until fragrant and there is additional browning. $(li)Pour in the chicken broth and add in shredded chicken and potatoes. Season with sage, thyme, rosemary, and bay leaves.

$(li)Bring to a boil over high heat. Then reduce heat to low and cover with a lid. Simmer for 15 minutes covered, stirring occasionally, until potatoes and carrots are tender. $(li)In a small bowl, stir together cold water and cornstarch until dissolved. Pour cornstarch mixture into the stew.
$(li)Stir over low heat until stew thickens, about 10 minutes. $(li)Season with more salt and pepper to taste. Remove bay leaves and serve hot with a garnish of parsley.
